articles.description: Arsenal dig deep for point against Liverpool - but at what cost as ominous gap with champions Manchester City opens up?
articles.title: Arsenal dig deep for point against Liverpool - but at what cost?

articles.description: Lando Norris cuts Max Verstappen’s lead to 47 points and labels his rival “dangerous” as the championship battle reaches boiling point at the Mexico City Grand Prix.
articles.title: Mexico City GP: Norris calls Verstappen 'dangerous' as Sainz wins

articles.description: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag says it feels "unfair and unjust" that his team lost after West Ham were awarded a late controversial penalty.
articles.title: Erik ten Hag: Manchester United boss feels West Ham defeat is 'unfair and unjust'

articles.description: With a goal and a pass described as one of the best in Premier League history, Cole Palmer is why fans pay to watch football, according to Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca.
articles.title: Cole Palmer: Chelsea player a 'reason why people pay' to watch football

articles.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?
articles.title: Troy Deeney's Team of the Week: Henderson, Dias, Yates, Palmer, Wood, Mbeumo

articles.description: Shaun Wane says his England team "need to be better" despite opening their two-Test series against Samoa with a 34-18 victory - saying their performance "would not have troubled Australia".
articles.title: England 34-18 SamoaL Shaun Wane says hosts' display "would not have troubled Australia"
